intro: Choriptera semhahensis, commonly known as the Semhah Valley moss, is a rare and specialized plant found in the high-altitude regions of the Semhah Valley. It belongs to the family Choripteraceae and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form, which helps it retain moisture in its harsh environment. The plant has small, scale-like leaves that are densely packed, providing insulation against cold temperatures. It thrives in shaded, moist microhabitats and is often found on rocky substrates. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a sensitive indicator of environmental stability.
